content.description:
P1, 5.8+: carefully climb to a high first bolt at the base of the left arete. Step left and climb the slab and arete to anchors shared with

Pet Cemetary

.
content.location: Climb the arete on the left side of Duke's Wall.

content.description: Climb using the face and obvious crack. This offwidth climb has great jamming for both hands and feet.
content.protection: Large cams, nuts, Â and Bigbros.
content.location:
It is located in between "Nancy" and "

Good Ol' Boys

".

content.description:
P1, 5.11c/d: climb the hand crack on the left side of the face, then step left and follow the line of bolts to anchors shared with

Sea of Lichen

. It is pumpy with crux crimps heading up and left at the last bolt. Fun climbing!
content.location:
It is on the left side of Duke's Wall and shares anchors with

Sea of Lichen

.

content.description:
This route is in the Poudre Canyon guidebook but not on MP, so I'm adding it here, because I confused it with "Unknown West Crack" on the North Face of Crystal Wall and went up it woefully unprepared. It starts at the obvious hand crack left of

Pumpin' Puff Muffins

and right of

Pet Cemetary

. It continues into the off width/chimney crack directly above where you can clip two bolts on the left to avoid falling onto the ledge. Double hand-sized pieces for the crack and at least one #4 or #5 makes it feel well-protected. A 15 foot traverse right at the top to a pair of bolts over terrible rock sets up the TR and rap or lower. Lots of looks rock crumbling off and loads of loose holds make it feel pretty scary, though I was able to find decent gear. The crux is deciding which loose hold to pull on midway up the offwidth section. This might be good if it's climbed a lot more.
content.protection: 2 reachable bolts above the ledge and a double hand-sized rack with a single 4 or 5.
content.location: On Duke's Wall, climb the obvious hand crack to a small ledge 15 feet up.

content.description:
Shares the 1st 2 bolts with

General Lee

, then heads out left clipping 3 more bolts to chains.  It is contrived but a fun little challenge for the Poudre nonetheless.  The 12b/c rating(?) is for the line that escapes left to the prow/offwidth at the last bolt, an earlier escape would certainly lower the grade.  The direct finish to the chains (completely avoiding the prow/ow) remains to be sent as far as I know - have at it!
content.location:
Just left of

General Lee

on the steep west face of the "Duke's Wall" (around the corner from the Crystal Wall to the west).

content.description: This route is steep, ugly, scary and frustrating. Not for the faint of heart. If you work up the courage you'll need to be fast to avoid death from the evil pump. One rest spot, grip for the good (but not good enough) holds and steep rock technique are needed for survival. Crux comes when clipping the 6th bolt. Watch out for some lose and dirty rock, which may degrade how many stars the route should get but I'm optimistic. Watch out on the ramp leading up the "actual route" it requires more technique than one might think and decking could be a problem if one falls from the top.
content.location: This is the third route from the right on the steep wall that is just south from the main crystal wall face. See the photos.

content.description: Squeeze up the steep, broken prow just left of the offwidth on the right side of the wall. It is slightly overhung.
content.protection:
5 bolts to anchors. This shares anchors with "

The General Lee

" to the left.
content.location:
It is located a few meters to the right of "

The General Lee

". This is the farthest right route (up the hill) on Duke's Wall.
